abstract: Age assessment is crucial and difficult component as migrants flee Middle Eastern nations for Europe; migrants under age 18 are given prioritized entry into Germany, but verification often proves thorny.
lead_paragraph: One of the biggest challenges for Germany in processing teenage migrants is to determine whether they are minors, as their legal situation changes radically on their 18th birthday.

headline.main: Distinguishing Minors From Adults in a Tide of Young Migrants
headline.print_headline: Migrant Fates Hinge On Assessment of Their Age

snippet: One of the biggest challenges for Germany in processing teenage migrants is to determine whether they are minors, as their legal situation changes radically on their 18th birthday.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
